do you need previous updates?

NEW FEATURES

Mounted Combat - Skyrim now allows you to do melee and ranged combat while riding a horse

BUG FIXES

General stability and memory optimizations
General AI pathfinding optimizations and bug fixes
Optimizations and crash fixes for data leaks
Fixed rare crash with lighting
Fixed crashes related to loading and saving games
Fixed crash with summoned creatures/NPCs
Fixed rare issue where saves would be corrupted
Improved logic for when ranged kill cams are played
Fixed issue with ranged kill cams while killing a dragon
Fixed rare issue with certain ranged kill cams not playing properly
Fixed issue with nirnroot lighting not properly cleaning up
Fixed issue where bow damage was being calculated incorrectly
Fixed rare problem with werewolf kill moves would not finish animating properly
In "The Break of Dawn" fixed rare issue where Meridia's Beacon would disappear from player's inventory
Fixed occasional issue where followers would disappear after player pays off a bounty after committing a crime
Fixed issue where certain creatures and NPCs would fail to respawn properly
Fixed rare issue with dialogue subtitles not displaying properly
Fixed issue with water appearing blurry when loading a saved game after creating a save underwater
Fixed issue where map cursor would occasionally disappear after closing a message box with Kinect enabled (Xbox 360)
Fixed rare issue with shouts only performing the first level and not other unlocked levels with Kinect enabled (Xbox 360)
Fixed issue where the shout buttons would stop working properly if users mashed LB and RB during cooldown with Kinect enabled (Xbox 360)

Install notes:

Extract  the archive contents to your Skyrim install directory.

Yes. This will screw with some peoples control setup. After updating with this, only my keyboard worked in the main menu, and after loading a save, I didn't even have keyboard control.

I remedied this by deleting the ini, and render, texts from my profiles games folder. Rerun the launcher, select your options, and then disable the gamepad option in the newly generated SkyrimPrefs.ini.

bGamepadEnable=n

Where 'n' = 0 to disable, or '1' to enable.
@slayerso: NO. You do not have to download all the other updates. The updates are cumulative. Just this one will contain all the previous updates.

A small word of caution...

If you are using any Skyrim mods that rework the skill trees (SkyRe in particular) it will conflict with some of the new trees from Dawnguard.  Also, the mounted combat isn't all bad, but it makes enemies that much harder, and will also conflict with Better Horses.  All in all, Dawnguard is probably worth getting, but if you use mods heavily, maybe not.

Why am I posting this here?  Because if you're not getting Dawnguard, this is the first and last update you should apply to Skyrim!  Even if you don't intend to get Dawnguard, heavy mod users should avoid update 10 because many of the AI routines added with Dawnguard are ACTUALLY in the patch itself, meaning that the patch, if installed without Dawnguard, will cause some strange AI bugs (i.e. enemies waiting on mounted combat support that never comes, etc.)

Personally I have spent many days on end now and still barely completed 4 of the quest lines, so I'm keeping my mods and holding off on Dawnguard for a while.
